alert.note: Alert for Eastern Chester (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 9:19PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern New Castle and southern Chester Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 919 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Brantwood, or near Elkton, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newark, New Castle, Pike Creek, Kemblesville, North Star, Glasgow, Bear, Landenberg, Wilmington Manor and Brookside. This includes Interstate 95 in Delaware between mile markers 0 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for northern Delaware...and southeastern Pennsylvania.
